quotes: María Ángela Holguín OSC Minister of Foreign Affairs In office 7 August 2010 – 7 August 2018
Permanent Representative of Colombia to the United Nations In office 16 September 2004 – 11 September 2006
Colombian Ambassador to Venezuela In office 16 September 2002 – 20 August 2004
has been serving as United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres’ Personal Envoy on Cyprus since 2024.
Spouse Santiago Jiménez Mejía ​ ​ ( m. 1983; div. 1990) ​
Born María Ángela Holguín Cuéllar ( 1963-11-13 ) 13 November 1963 (age 62)
She graduated from the University of the Andes in 1988 with a bachelor's degree in political science
she also completed a specialization there in public management and administrative institutions in 1992
In 2010, while Holguín was serving as Colombia's Representative to CAF – Development Bank of Latin America and the Caribbean in Buenos Aires
Global Partnership for Sustainable Development Data, Member of the Board of Directors (since 2017)
Holguín married Santiago Jiménez Mejía on 27 August 1983 but later divorced having no children
She later met Carlos Espinosa Pérez, with whom she had a son, Antonio, born 23 January 1991
United Nations, press release of 5 January 2024
Permanent Representative of Colombia to the United Nations 2004–2006
Minister of Foreign Affairs of Colombia 2010–2018
Minister of the Interior and Justice Germán Vargas Lleras (2010–2011)
Minister of the Interior Germán Vargas Lleras (2011–2012)

roles.title: Permanent Representative of Colombia to the United Nations
quotes: Permanent Representative of Colombia to the United Nations
studied at the Gimnasio Femenino school in Bogota
In 2010, while Holguín was serving as Colombia's Representative to CAF – Development Bank of Latin America and the Caribbean in Buenos Aires
a meeting held in Santa Marta between the two Presidents
Holguín then travelled to Ecuador to meet with Ecuadorian Foreign Minister Ricardo Patiño
to convince Quito to renew diplomatic ties and to personally invite President Rafael Correa
Fe de Bogotá [Genealogies of Santa Fe de Bogotá]
